title: Is this font called 'Chemical´?
content:
I once had a font which I used for the following ’logo’ for a magazine called LUKSUS.

I think it was called Chemical and I’m quite sure it was a freebie. Somehow I’ve lost the font and I just can’t track it down anywhere. The fonts I find when I search for ’chemical’ is somehow more techno-ish or what ever you would expect fromt that name. So either it gone for good or it has a different name.

Does anyone know anything about it?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121113417im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/luksus_logo_3992.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Oxxo advertising face - Burghley {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121113417/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27486 "Go to previous forum topic") [When Sport and Type Collide ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121113417/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27506 "Go to next forum topic")
author: peter_monrad
